dialogueSequence.sentence: Hail good knight! How might one reach the castle?
Oh I can tell you, but only if the price is right.
Bark Bark (Does it look like we have any money?)
Sure is! Rufus here loves to have his belly rubbed.
Bork woof (Would you please stop calling me Rufus?)
He’s adorable! Protecting such a creature will be payment enough for me.
Be careful, this one’s bite is worse than his bark.
Bork Bork (That was due to circumstances.)
(That’s such a weak excuse. Why is father making me do this?)
Allow me to be your shield.
Any physical attack will bounce right off me, but magic will fry me right quick.
My master has been acting strangely ever since he found this stone.
He’s been extorting profits from the townsfolk, his greed surpassing my own.
Our masters befell the same fate, one of woe whence stones taketh their righteousness and spit on their good name.
Oh, and before I forget: The king’s room is locked with a special mechanism.
You must find a switch deep in the castle to unlock it.
